roleset.name: think, believing, imagining

role.descr: Attributive (please look at the examples-- this is tricky)

example.name: think-v: transitive
example.text: A Lorillard spokeswoman thought "This is an old story."

example.name: think-v: intransitive, with subject of thinking
example.text: People weren't thinking about targeting 10 years ago.

example.name: think-v: transitive, with subject of thinking
example.text: People weren't thinking anything about targeting 10 years ago.

example.name: think-v: fronted
example.text: [Kent cigarettes were sold]-1, the company thought *Trace*-1

example.name: think-v: inverted
example.text: [What matters is what advertisers will pay,]-1 thought *Trace*-1 Newsweek's chairman

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: She had thought that these stores were only crowded on the weekends , but on a rainy weekday in November she decided she did n't feel like cooking and went to buy some prepared foods at the RT - Mart 's deli department .
example.arg: that these stores were only crowded on the weekends

example.name: think-v: attributive
example.text: They think of us as a good partner.

example.name: ARG1
example.text: It was originally thought that the Taipei - Ilan Expressway , due for completion in 2003 , would also bring Pinglin new benefits , but the government is now planning to restrict the interchange to only large vehicles and locals from Pinglin .
example.arg: that the Taipei - Ilan Expressway , due for completion in 2003 , would also bring Pinglin new benefits

example.name: think-v: have a new idea
example.text: ``I can't think of any reason to join Lloyd's now,'' says Keith Whitten, a British businessman and a Lloyd's member since 1979.

example.name: thought-n: Within LVC
example.text: I once had the thought that , relying on Japan 's technology and economic strength she would be able to build a road to the summit or simply put up a cable car.
example.arg: that , relying on Japan 's technology and economic strength she would be able to build a road to the summit or simply put up a cable car.

example.name: thought-n: no mention of actual thought
example.text: She writes of her thoughts of her own possible death as she approaches the birth of one of her children.
example.arg: as she approaches the birth of one of her children.

example.name: thought-n: Args 0 & 2
example.text: Kim Hyung Jun discusses his thoughts about going solo.

example.name: thought-n: With thought itself
example.text: The thought that we could just do what needs to be done to make it happen never passes their lips.
example.arg: that we could just do what needs to be done to make it happen

example.name: thinking-n: 0,1,2
example.text: This would explain people's thinking nothing of advertising 40 years ago.

roleset.note: THINK-V NOTES: Member of Vncls consider-29.9-2, wish-62. Frame edited by Arrick (from think.01-v)
THOUGHT-N NOTES: Based on verb entry think.01; corresponds to Vncls consider-29.9-2, wish-62. (from thought.01-n)

roleset.name: to invent, come up with

example.name: think_up-v
example.text: If their plan is something WHNP-0 they thought up, it will fail.

roleset.note: THINK_UP-V NOTES: Roleset based on instances in New Testament. No corresponding VN class. (from think.02-v)

roleset.name: mull over

example.name: think_over-v: both args
example.text: Why-1 do n't you think it over by yourself [*-1]?

roleset.note: THINK_OVER-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-7. (from think.03-v)

roleset.name: consider fully

example.name: think_through-v: both args
example.text: However , if we think through the causes of such problems , we will find that we should not only blame the people of Hong Kong .

roleset.note: THINK_THROUGH-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-7. (from think.04-v)

roleset.name: 'it seems to me', 'i think ___'

example.name: methinks-v
example.text: Criminal charges + lifetime ban from all grounds *PRO* methinks *trace*.
example.arg: Criminal charges + lifetime ban from all grounds

roleset.note: METHINKS-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. No VNcls. (from methinks.01-v)

roleset.name: think about too much

example.name: overthink-v
example.text: I think 0 we 're overthinking this whole thing.

roleset.note: OVERTHINK-V NOTES: Frame created by Arrick (from overthink.01-v)
